stable_tour.quote: We bought her after she won a juvenile hurdle at Killarney for Joseph O'Brien and she was second at Down Royal behind Teriferma, who he also trains, and she looks smart. She's a big, scopey filly who'll improve with time and she'll probably start off in the Wensleydale Hurdle at Wetherby. Then there are Listed fillies' races at Newbury and Doncaster. She's come from a good place and has been well schooled. 16-10-24

runners.name: Val Bassett
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De Saint Julien & Regula

prev_owners.owner: Haras De Saint Julien & Mme Regula Vannod

stable_tour.quote: A nice big horse who will have needed his run back. He'll probably stay a mile and a half and should be capable of improvement as he had some good form in France, including when beating Enemy. 04-05-23

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't go that quick and it can't turn into a sprint with Quercus Robur, he needs everything to go smooth. The drop back in trip didn't suit him last time. Back up to two miles today was ideal. He's a bit quirky, going down to the start he was a bit reluctant but you just have to kid him into races a little bit - Kevin Stott, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He wins every year and has won four times altogether over hurdles now. He's co-owned by me and our vet, Sally Booth. He'll be coming back in this week. But we don't know when the soft ground's going to come in this year - it was early last year, so he started earlier, having his first run at Hexham in early October. He then won at Catterick in December before finishing second twice. He's had two wins at Sedgefield and two at Catterick but we may have to go further afield with him as he's now rated 121 and there aren't that many races locally for him. 22-08-24

4:43.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (Div I)

prev_owners.owner: John Rhodes Peter Timmins & Dale Wilsdon
Mrs C Barclay & Ben Haslam Racing Synd

quotes.race: Betway Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: First-time-out winners don't come along very often! We've always liked Sandret and he's always shown a bit of class, it was a case of just taking our time with him. He was in a maiden or novice here a few weeks ago and I thought he was a certainty but it was called off because of the flu. We're delighted. He's going to improve as he's just a shell of a horse, but he was ready for today - Ben Haslam, trainer.

runners.name: Rubellite
runners.owner: Tony Culhane Racing & The Good Racing Co

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Classified Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: I just said to James [Callow] the owner there, that I actually thought Jimmy Sullivan had got away on us; he gave his a peach out in front, but Ana Emaraaty did all his best work in the last furlong. He relaxed real good for me early on, so it was perfect. The further he went, the better he went, and I wouldn't be surprised if he got a bit further as well - Paul Mulrennan, jockey speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He'll be one for the all-weather. He's a bit of a lad and we've given him the summer off, and I expect he'll do well on the all-weather. Last year he didn't take too many races and I was guilty of running him too often. But I'm looking forward to training him during the winter and there are big bonuses to be won with horses like him. 02-10-24

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We were expecting a good run but were worried about the draw and the rain-softened ground. Saisons D'Or has proved his versatility and it opens up more options - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Saisons D'Or battled well to the line. He's a consistent horse and the mile suited him well here. He was a bit gassy as a youngster but settles much better now and that enables him to stay this trip - Jack Garritty, jockey.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Rider Restricted Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bomb Squad is a superstar and he has been in spectacular form this year. He's run some good races over seven [furlongs] prior to this without winning so we were confident he'd get the trip and, to be fair to Cieren Fallon, he insisted we stepped him up to seven - John Mackie, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He only made his racecourse debut in May when third over 5f. His work has always been decent and I thought stepping him up to 6f next time out at Redcar would see him win. But, despite running a smashing race, he had to take second behind Happier. He ran back over the same course and distance last time when he was third but came back rather sore, hence he hasn't run in more than two months. He's sound again now and an opening mark of 67 looks attractive to me. I'm not sure whether he'll go for another maiden or straight to a handicap. He's a fine, big gelding with lots of potential. 30-08-23

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Pop Dancer would win first time and it was just greenness that beat him. He did it well today - assistant trainer Robin O'Ryan.

Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
Mrs D Dalby & Harrowgate Bloodstock Ltd

quotes.race: Whatton Manor Stud Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series)
quotes.quote: Phoenix Star likes a good pace and he likes horses stopping which in this ground they did today. He's never run on ground like this so I had no idea how he would go. When he dead-heated here [July 2021] it was good to soft but Oliver [Stammers, jockey] said it is very heavy out there so maybe he likes it heavy. Let it rain and rain - Ian Fowler, joint-owner.

prev_owners.owner: Sam Farthing, Linda McGarry & Ken Nicol

stable_tour.quote: He won once for Johnny Murtagh at Roscommon in September before joining us in the spring. He has had two runs for us, the first rather disappointing, but I thought he ran with more promise last time out when third at Newcastle. He certainly works like a much better horse at home than he has shown on the course, so I am hopeful that when we can get it all together with him he can do well. He does not like the ground too fast. 22-06-22

quotes.race: Follow Sun Racing On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Coco Bean was nice and fresh and jumped out well. We got a good position and then he really stuck his head out - Josh Bryan, rider.

4:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (Watered)

quotes.race: Carrickmines Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Lieutenant Command just seems to be a different horse on that ground. The good news is that he stays in training this year and long term he could be a Galway Plate horse - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Lieutenant Command was brilliant from the start when we schooled him. We always thought a lot of him. Hopefully he can step up in grade, he's a grand big horse - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Glenman Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lieutenant Command is a huge horse and he only started to come late last season. He's getting there now. Sean said he found it very hard to get him into a rhythm but he was very impressed with him considering. We hope he keeps improving and we'll stay at this trip for now - Noel Meade, trainer

runners.name: Yealand
runners.owner: P And Mrs G A Clarke

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Best Odds Daily Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Yealand is still a quite young and immature horse and he's probably one for staying chases next season - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Here's To Another Greyland 25 Years Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We've always thought a bit of Yealand and he's a big raw horse. I'm not sure he was suited by the hill at Carlisle last time, so we've come back to a flat track. He'll make a lovely chaser and we'll see whether we go again this season or not - Alan O'Keeffe, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won two last season and whatever he did over hurdles was always going to be a bonus because he's going to make a better chaser. He would want some ease in the ground. He's a beautiful horse and he's probably well handicapped off his current mark. He'll benefit from his first run of the season at Uttoxeter and I'd say he'll be worth following this winter. 05-12-24

quotes.race: Falcons Events Proudly Support Hexham Racecourse Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're absolutely delighted with Choose A Copper. He had good form over hurdles but he's going to take it to another level over fences and it's just so exciting. We're sitting here watching Chepstow and thinking about who we're going to come up against for the rest of the season. It's great to start them off here at Hexham and he can step up next time. We might try and find a similar race and stick at this trip before going up in grade after that - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Mick Blair Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Choose A Copper is an outstanding horse. He moves really well and if you lead him you have to run to keep up with him. Working him at home, he goes like a stayer but he has power and a bit of pace so for a long-distance prospect to win over two miles is good. He's a little bit green, he needs a bit of experience. I can't wait for him to go chasing but I'll have to be patient about that - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I've been delighted with him. He won his novice handicap chase at Hexham nicely and I still think he's off a good mark. We'll step him up next time and I'd love to take him to Sandown or Newbury as I can see him jumping well around there. He's a very nice horse. 30-10-24

runners.name: Jet Legs
runners.owner: Mrs Suzy Brown & Peter R Brown

quotes.race: Schloss Roxburghe Hotel Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jet Legs had no weight on his back and a good 5lb claimer. He's a nice horse for the future. He's a laid-back character, a good traveller through the race. His owners have been very patient, you'll see the best of him as a staying chaser; Martin Todhunter, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Post North Monet's Garden Series Final Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hello Judge is is a lovely big, strong horse. He ran over three miles last time here but he's a two-and-a-half miler. It's a nice prize and this is the first time we've won one of the finals. We declared him for Hexham on Tuesday, thinking the ground here would be too quick - he'll not go there now! - Ian Hamilton, owner and trainer's husband.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV Now Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I just had to try and get Hello Judge in a rhythm and it was good to see him get back to form. The stable has been a bit quiet lately but hopefully that's them turning the corner - Danny McMenamin, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Mark Nield Wealth Management Go North One Man Series Final Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's quirky, but is really progressive and a super jumper. Trac can win over further, but we dropped him back in trip last time on this ground to qualify him for the final and still won nicely that day. He's done his bit for us. The handicapper had his say but he's still improving - Micky Hammond, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Trac was actually second in this race last year, but he bumped into one and he certainly wasn't winning out of turn. His biggest asset is his jumping and we'll have to move up in grade now, but he's physically and mentally ready for that - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Grand Voyage
runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet, M Trinquet & O Trinquet

quotes.quote: Lawrenny is a nice horse. I don't know what happened at Leicester but it was barely raceable and the better ground here helped him. He learned a lot from his first run too - Alan O'Keeffe, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: A really nice prospect. He won his bumper at Newcastle in March and has been given plenty of time afterwards. He'll be going for a 2m4f novice hurdle next week, provided there's plenty of ease in the ground. He's a proper mudlark. 05-12-24

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was nice that Rewired had one to aim at down the back straight and he deserved to get his head in front - Luke Scott, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Was precocious enough to win as a two-year-old over a mile. He needed his first run this year at Lingfield to blow the cobwebs away and I thought he would go well at Salisbury last time, but he just did not see out the trip. It was my mistake and we will go back to 1m2f and see what happens. Soft ground is preferred and I would be disappointed if we could not at some point this season. 02-06-21

quotes.quote: V Twelve is a nice, big horse and I hope he'll progress - William Maggs, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had a flirtation with hurdling and showed ability at it. I've never hadajumps winner but my assistant Jack is mad keen on it, and it was a good idea as he's got a future in that code. He ran poorly on his return to the Flat at Bath - we'll give him another run but he's been on the go for a long time and may be due a break. 27-04-23

quotes.race: Support The Injured Jockeys Fund Today Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

quotes.quote: Sue [Smith] has worked miracles with Romeo Brown - the things that she has done have been brilliant. He fell twice here over hurdles but his jumping was ironed out and all credit must go to all the team at Sue's. He's earned a rest now and chasing is on the cards - Richard Longley, owner.

quotes.race: Schloss Roxburghe Go North Cab On Target Handicap Hurdle (Series Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Romeo Brown is a nice horse and we've only just found him out. I was keen to make plenty of use of him turning in after his good form at Hexham and Carlisle - Thomas Wilmott, jockey.

quotes.race: Watch Irish Racing On RacingTV Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Romeo Brown is a good horse who's genuine and tries hard. He'll probably be better going back left-handed in time and will be a better horse next year -  Phil Kirby, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Go North Cab On Target Handicap Hurdle (Series Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Les's Legacy was given a textbook ride by Dillan. That was tremendous, it's good when a plan works because quite often it doesn't. This has been the plan since the Go North series came out. I try to have something for each race and we thought Les's Legacy would be better over this two miles four than the two miles, although he qualified for both; Susan Corbett, trainer.

runners.name: Always A Reason
runners.owner: Miss Maria D Myco & John Johnson

quotes.race: Goresbridge Handicap
quotes.quote: Cage Rattler found the trip a bit short for him at the Curragh last day but we were more confident today. He is still green and he will improve again. He handles a dig in the ground - John Kinsella, trainer.

runners.name: Hes Bresilian
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing & T S Ingham

runners.name: Kingston Rock
runners.owner: J L And Mrs H R Gledson

stable_tour.quote: This colt is another example of us working closely with the 'Rogues'. Obviously he has a lovely pedigree and was purchased at the breeze-ups. He never saw a racecourse until April when a very impressive winner at Yarmouth over 1m2f. He didn't enjoy the heavy ground next time out when second to Perfuse, but on much quicker ground at Ripon last time he was a comfortable winner under a penalty. He had been given an entry in the King George V Stakes at Royal Ascot and was around 16-1 when we scratched him. We have had to be very patient with this colt and Tony [Elliott] and the Rogues have been very supportive, as they always are. He has won over 1m2f and 1m3f and I don't think 1m4f will pose any problems and he could even get 1m6f in time. His opening handicap mark is 90, which was to be expected after his two wins in novice company. There is a three-year-old handicap at Ascot which is run on that extraordinarily busy Saturday when the July Cup is run which is an option, but he is entered to run in the 1m6f handicap at Haydock this week. There is definitely more to come from him this year. 06-07-23

He was very disappointing at Wetherby last time but before that ran a really nice race at Carlisle over a 2m1f trip that was too short for him. He's a lovely, big horse and maybe that Carlisle race took a bit more out of him than we thought, so he's having a bit of a break. 22-01-25

runners.name: Forest Blaze
runners.owner: M Blades, Craggs, Clark And Cambridge

quotes.race: Kirkstyle Inn & Sportsmans Rest Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

We were very happy with his run over two miles last time as we expected the step up in trip to really suit. He's got a couple of entries in the next few days, but I'm not sure if he'll take them up as he's got the job done now - Mark Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Summer Party Pack Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Coral Blue worked well during the week so we were quietly confident. He was getting all the concessions. We'll see what the handicapper does and there's no reason why he can't go back on the Flat - Seamus Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Santa Clarita
runners.breeder: M Eric Aubree & M Claude Aubree

4:05.race_name: Deb And Wendy's 60th Birthday Celebrations Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

quotes.race: DragonBet Real Bookies Backing Local Racing Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was just a good school round but that would have done his confidence the world of good. Gyename was always a good jumper over hurdles and he showed today he has a future over fences. Brendan Powell, jockey talking to RacingTV.

quotes.race: Gore Browne Investment Management Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gyenyame ran really well last time and the form's worked out lovely. He was unlucky to unseat before that and has always shown plenty. He was crying out for that trip and it was a nice performance. Whether he beat anything doesn't matter. We'll see what we do, but he could go back on the Flat in the summer - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well under 12st 2lb at Wincanton when he was second. It was a good run and he's a good solid horse - he'll jump a fence as well. He could go for a handicap at Cheltenham's November meeting. We bought him after winning his last two on the Flat for Andrew Balding so we could explore that too. 10-11-23

He won for us last year and has been second and fourth at Cheltenham this season and we'll find a race for him shortly, but we bought him off the Flat and there's a thought we could run him in that sphere again in the summer. He's a nice, solid horse who might not get into the Pertemps Final, but he's done well for us. 18-01-24

He ran very well in his first chase at Ludlow at the start of the month when he finished second. He looks to get three miles well but doesn't want really soft ground. As he gets more experience over fences there should be more to come from him. 23-11-23
He won twice in November 2022 but has been second three times since then. He needs to run somewhere soon - he is rated 101 and if he drops a pound it gives us some more options. 30-10-24

5:05.race_name: St George Ladies Evening 23rd April Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Chase Series Qual')

quotes.race: Belvoir Mares' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That's our first winner since Pinnacle Park won at the Cheltenham October meeting and this game drives you mad. We've had plenty of seconds and thirds of late, so they've not been running badly and it's nice to get a winner. We weren't going to run Bobbi's Beauty over fences until next season but she'd been schooling well at home - Martin Keighley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Owned by my wife Mary, she won a bumper at Southwell just over a year ago. She's still a novice over hurdles. She could run in a handicap as she's had three runs, but the temptation is to go for a novice because she gets the GB bonus. She's in at Market Rasen on Friday. 06-06-24

prev_owners.owner: Exors D Cocks & S Livesey-Van Dorst
D Cocks & Mrs S Livesey-Van Dorst

4:35.race_name: Maundy Thursday Evening Meeting 17th April Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Chicago Storm
runners.breeder: Ashtown B/S, O B Sarl, E Puerari, G Bozo

prev_owners.owner: Anthony Carey & Martin W Walsh & Derek Dunne
Anthony Carey & Conor Brett & Derek Dunne & M W Walsh

quotes.race: #90 January & February Hospitality Offer Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chicago Storm's work has been very good at home, I can't fault him, and he'll probably go on to better things. I have nothing in mind yet, but he's a very straightforward and easy horse, and he has plenty of ability - Daisy Hitchins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's run in one bumper, at Chepstow in November and finished fourth. He's one that can improve. 30-10-24

He's a full-brother to our very useful Malaya, who won five races over hurdles, notably Sandown's Imperial Cup. As he'd done plenty of pre-training in France before he came to us, we wanted to crack on with him and he looked the ideal sort for the new three-year-old National Hunt novice hurdles that have been introduced this season. He'd been showing us plenty at home, working well with Knappers Hill, but was disappointing at Newton Abbot and returned with a touch of sore shins. Obviously we won't be rushing him. 31-10-22

prev_owners.owner: Kildonan Gold Racing 2 & I J Jardine

quotes.race: Don't Miss The Newton Abbot Country Show Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Clearance is absolutely incredible here. He's got so much speed, and Tom [Cannon] rides him with such confidence because of that. He beat a fresh four-year-old as well. I'm not sure when the next race here is but he'll be back - Michael Blake, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Live Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: They got racing quite early which helped Clearance, as they were slowing up in the last furlong - Hector Crouch, jockey.

quotes.race: BetVictor Loyalty Club Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Through The Ages switched off nicely in front, jumped well and sealed the deal. Burdett Road went past us like we were stood still last time, but you saw what he did next time, and the bigger, galloping track has helped him. He's maturing all the time and I'd like to think he'd actually be better in a years' time. He's a big horse, he's got a nice pedigree and hopefully he can give the owners a good bit of fun - Jamie Moore, trainer's representative.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice last winter at Newbury and Plumpton but needed his comeback at Chepstow a couple of weeks ago. He's raced predominantly around two miles but we'll look to step him up in trip now and he should be all right. 29-10-24

2:35.race_name: Racing To School Blundell's Preparatory School Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in the Newbury sales bumper before winning at Plumpton. He's schooling nicely and is one to look out for. 14-11-24

runners.name: Fasol
runners.owner: P J Vogt And Bryan Drew

quotes.race: DragonBet - Oncourse And Online Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Fasol choked at Windsor last time so we had his wind done and he liked the better ground here. He'll have plenty of options during the spring - Paul Nicholls, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: Horses who come to us from France mid-season often take longer to acclimatise and he was a prime example. Having run just okay on his hurdling debut in January, he was a lot better at Kempton four months later. As he was Group-placed on the Flat in France, we switched codes in June and he ran a blinder in the Queen Alexandra, not quite seeing out the two and three-quarter miles. So now we're in the unusual position of having a horse highly rated on the Flat who is lowly rated over hurdles. Hopefully, that's something we can now take advantage of when he reappears in the two-mile novice handicap at Cheltenham's Paddy Power meeting. He probably wants a bit further, but if they go a good gallop that should suit him. He had a nice run round at Wincanton in their charity race eight days ago and that was ideal. I suspect there's bags of improvement to come. 04-11-24

3:05.race_name: Par Inn Cornwall Mares' Handicap Hurdle

prev_owners.owner: L & J Perkins, N Freeman, R & P Scott

stable_tour.quote: She's been disappointing. She's one of the most expensive horses I've bought, by Walk In The Park and out of a Grade 2-winning dam. She got herself handicapped through inexperience. The track didn't suit her on her handicap debut and she's probably going to run in a few weeks on a conventional track. We're still figuring her out. She's not the biggest but shows plenty at home, so we've got plenty of hope she might turn it around. 12-03-25

3:35.race_name: Paddy Kenneally Cillas Cottage 1955 Winner Handicap Hurdle

quotes.race: Buy Your 2018 Annual Membership Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: He jumped very well and although he didn't finish out his races in bumpers, he's taken well to hurdles and really fought to win today - Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Us And Them.

quotes.race: www.racinghomeforeaster.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm surprised Us And Them didn't win a bumper. He jumped like a buck and he's a horse I've always thought the world of - JJ Slevin, rider

prev_owners.owner: Mme Sandra Hosselet & Bloodstock Agency Ltd

quotes.race: Racing To School Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zucayan travelled very strongly and jumped the best he's jumped apart from two out, when he nearly took it with us. We always thought he had a good engine but his jumping didn't help in those novice hurdles - Nick Slatter, jockey.

runners.name: Jim De Sarti
runners.breeder: E A R L Pestour, Claude Pestour & Nelly

stable_tour.quote: A winner in France, he looks talented and precocious - just the type to give the Million In Mind members plenty to shout about. You'll see him in novice hurdles. 30-10-23

prev_owners.owner: Robin Gillard, Rory Gillard, Tim Seegar

quotes.race: Knocknarea Opportunity Claiming Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief seems to enjoy it out in front and letting him dictate. He jumped brilliant and galloped all the way to the line - James Smith, rider

quotes.race: Join The Business Club At Naas Racecourse Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief toughed it out well when they came to him. I expected him to run well. He came on from his last start when running a cracker at Punchestown. Sam said that when he went into pop hurdles he made mistakes, when he saw a horse he needed to make his mind up for him, and I thought when they came to him he'd be caught. Thankfully he pulled it out all the way to the line. We'll look for something similar next - Matthew Smith, trainer

quotes.race: Racing Again On 27th May Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief did it well and got a lovely run around, I was able to control it wherever I went. When I got stuck into him up the straight he picked up well. The ground was a little worry as I thought he might have needed a cut, but he was fourth in his maiden on good ground. He won over two miles on heavy ground over hurdles and seems top enjoy it out in front - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bigz Belief got a grand ride, I told him to go out in front. We were a bit worried about the ground. His jumping was a lot better today - Matt Smith, trainer.

quotes.race: Corbettsports Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that because we'd been holding off going over fences with Force De Frap. I wanted to get to know him well and get him a little bit stronger, and thankfully it's paid off - Emma-Jane Bishop, trainer.

quotes.race: Barry's Sark To Cheltenham Bee Keeper Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It worked out really well. It took a while to figure out Force De Frap, but all credit to Emma (Jane Bishop). I sourced this horse out of France for my cousins, he never set the world alight but was consistent. He always gave me that sort of feel but just wasn't performing, I asked Emma to take a bit of a gamble and she bought him. She's worked wonders, nothing short of a miracle, and he'll come on for that again - Harrison Beswick, rider.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Free Horse Racing Tips Handicap (Bath Summer Stayers' Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Joe (Tickle) said Taritino needs a bit of daylight and if he doesn't jump he can be tricky but he did jump. To be fair he was very free, I managed to get two breathers into him but when the other horse came alongside he lit me up again. It was a good effort considering. He'll probably get 2m - Hollie Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing.

runners.name: Prince Rhinegold
runners.owner: Mrs D Robinson Mrs & Mrs Livesey-Van Dorst

5:35.race_name: April 3 For 2 Race Meetings Offer Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

stable_tour.quote: We've a team of around 25 bumper horses for this season and this one looks a lovely prospect based on his one run so far, in the valuable Goffs Bumper at the Punchestown festival, when he looked the likely winner before fading close home. But I'm not rushing him. We'll find a decent bumper some time in December and look after him. 04-11-24

runners.name: Roi Du Risk
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu

runners.name: Time Is Golden
runners.owner: Sara Spratt And The Tim Club
